# add(_:)

**Instance Method**

Creates a new object and sets it as the receiver’s content object.

## Declaration

```swift
@IBAction @MainActor func add(_ sender: Any?)
```

## Parameters

- **sender**: Typically the object that invoked this method.

## Discussion

Creates a new object of the appropriate entity (specified by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSObjectController/entityName]) or class (specified by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSObjectController/objectClass])—see [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSObjectController/newObject()]—and sets it as the receiver’s content object using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSObjectController/addObject(_:)].

### Special Considerations

Beginning with OS X v10.4 the result of this method is deferred until the next iteration of the runloop so that the error presentation mechanism can provide feedback as a sheet.

## Managing objects

- **newObject()**: Creates and returns a new object of the appropriate class.
- **addObject(_:)**: Sets the receiver’s content object.
- **removeObject(_:)**: Removes a given object from the receiver’s content.
- **canAdd**: A Boolean value that indicates whether an object can be added to the receiver using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSObjectController/add(_:)].
- **remove(_:)**: Removes the receiver’s content object.
- **canRemove**: A Boolean value that indicates whether an object can be removed from the receiver.
